intro: Androsace fedtschenkoi, commonly known as the Fedtschenko's Androsace, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and cool, moist climates. The plant is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of alpine flora.
